sen.j: 惣掟（そうおきて）は、中世日本において、百姓らが自主的に定めた惣村内部の法令。
sen.e: So-okite is a statute that peasants defined independently within a soson (a community consisting of peasants' self-governing association) in medieval Japan.

sen.j: 中世前期（平安時代～鎌倉時代）までは、民衆（百姓など）を規制する法令は、律令・公家法・本所法・武家法など支配者により定められたものしか存在していなかった。
sen.e: Before early medieval (from Heian period to Kamakura period), general public (peasant etc.) was regulated only by the laws established by rulers, such as the Ritsuryo codes, court noble law, honjo (proprietor or guarantor of manor) law, and samurai law.
